Meall Corranaich

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Meall Corranaich is part of the Ben Lawers range, and is well seen from the Lawers visitor centre. It can be climbed from there up a steep ridge but is more usually ascended from the northwest, starting from the summit of the pass.

 You have not climbed Meall Corranaich.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1069 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.96/5
Rating: 3.0/5 (110 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Meall Corranaich and Meall a' Choire Leith from the Lairig an Lochain

Other routes and challenges

Meall Corranaich can also be climbed from the Ben Lawers car park, ascending the steep ridge which links with Beinn Ghlas.

The biggest bagging route hereabouts is a circuit of the 7 Lawers Munros as part of a horseshoe round the Allt a' Chobhair from Camusvrachan in Glen Lyon.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
